Posts.Content: May 6, 2009 09:36PM - edited May 6, 2009 09:38PM by Nicole_Bronx I agree, as soon as my mom was diagnosed in April of 2009 (she's 46 and i'm 27) I immediately went online for research and am so glad to have come across this site/discussion boards.  I immediately joined and have felt the kind words from these strong women and am thankful.  I told my mom that I joined and have shared with her all of the info I have found and some stories that have helped us get a handle on everything.  Its okay to cry together and talk together, just try and keep the outlook positive yet realistic. My mother has involved us all ( my father, 2 sisters and my brother...i am the oldest) and she wants/needs us there w/ her every step of the way, we have been to see a couple of surgeons and have picked the one we all (esp my mother) feels most comfortable with, now on to the next step (blood work and setting the date for surgery)...it helps to be open b/c we all are moving forward together... I wish your mom, you and ur family the best!
Posts.Title: Mother Diagnosed TheSon Nicole_Bronx

Posts.Content: May 23, 2009 07:05PM Nicole_Bronx wrote: ::sigh:: mom is feeling sick, sore throat, and her stitches are slightly painful...trying to keep her ice packs on her...I thought I was dealing with all of this okay, but maybe all of my stress is just building up inside.  I felt lightheaded yesterday and I have a really bad headache today could be these freaking allergies but I went to bed and just cried myself to sleep last nite, I don't even know why I was crying, I don't know what I was feeling.  Maybe I am just feeling helpless, I wish I could make it all go away.  I just needed to vent/get some emotion out...I know what I am feeling or going thru personally is no where near what she is feeling or going thru emotionally/physically...if she's strong enough to handle the situation, then i will be even stronger for her...thanks for listening...
Posts.Title: For my Mom aka Superwoman Nicole_Bronx Nicole_Bronx

Posts.Content: May 22, 2009 03:50AM Nicole_Bronx wrote: Hi Cathi! It is actually Drs orders lol! she's not allowed to move her arm where she had her lymph nodes removed until we go and get her final pathology and all of that...but she is getting up here and there to get her snacks or just for change of scenary from her bedroom to living room, although i get nervous if she moves too much.  She's doing very well though, not in too much pain...i will try and allow her to do what she feels she can w/o getting too worried lol!  Board games and cards is a fantastic idea, actually we usually have game nites on the wknd soooo y not just keep the tradition going (duh! lol!) y didnt i think of that??? Hi Rockysmom! I like that idea! we do have some photos that need to be transferred to albums...it would be great for this long memorial day wknd! Thanks :-)
Posts.Title: Any Ideas??? Nicole_Bronx Nicole_Bronx

Posts.Content: May 6, 2009 09:52PM Nicole_Bronx wrote: Hi! I am happy to hear that things r looking positive for u! I do feel better reading about others experiences and I thank u so much for responding .  I wish u all the best as u go through the rest of ur treatment and definitely will have a positive outlook and thoughts for you, my mother and the other women in this ugly situation.  We actually saw 2 surgeons in the last 2 days and have picked the one that we are very very comfortable with.  Her outlook was very comforting and now I can say i KNOW that we will make it thru this...i love those words "breast cancer is no longer a death sentence" As ur journey goes on, continue to be the strong woman that u are **hugs**
Posts.Title: For my Mom aka Superwoman Nicole_Bronx Nicole_Bronx

Posts.Content: May 6, 2009 11:22PM Nicole_Bronx wrote: For mom_of_2: Yes i do have a 14 yr old sister! As well as an 18 yr old brother and another sister who is 20 yrs old...i am 27 the oldest of course.  My family (including my dad) is actually very open and involved as is urs, my mom has had each and every one of us involved from the day the was diagnosed (she wouldn't have it any other way).  My youngest sis has actually been handling all of this very well, she has definitely impressed me with how mature she has been in handling all of this.  We encourage her to ask any and every question she has, which she has been.  Congratulations on your daughter graduating!  It must be an emotional day for me, ur posting is the second one i am tearing up on today...its so inspiring to hear u say "we beat this and plan a long and happy life together".... but ugh! that ugly word..."chemo" I am trying to keep a positive outlook and praying that it won't be necessary...it just sux! ::sigh:: i just cant wait for surgery to be done with so we can know for sure...i wish this all could have been done YESTERDAY!!! Thanks so much for ur kind words...I am now going to try and sleep...Good Night!
Posts.Title: For my Mom aka Superwoman Nicole_Bronx Nicole_Bronx
For my Mom aka Superwoman Nicole_Bronx Nicole_Bronx

Posts.Content: May 14, 2009 02:28PM Nicole_Bronx wrote: Haven't logged on in a couple of days, i've had a really bad cold/allergies, I will be sure to reply to each of u as soon as I get the chance :-) Thanks to all of u for the support, advice and shoulders to lean on... As an update, it seems that the situation was worse off than we thought :-( i will edit the posting to include her new stats...but again i must say that i am so glad that we switched doctors!   *big hugs to all*
Posts.Title: For my Mom aka Superwoman Nicole_Bronx Nicole_Bronx

Posts.Content: May 23, 2009 09:46PM Nicole_Bronx wrote: Hi Kathy! It's always so great to hear from you :-)  Well, there was a bug going around the house so I am hoping that its just that or her allergies...She has that feeling like a fever may be coming on...if it persists I will feel more comfortable calling the doctor (w/ this holiday wknd I hope it won't be necessary, but if i have to i hope she will be avail).  Mom is actually up and about exept for yesterday and today b/c that's when she started feeling sick.  She wanted to go outside yesterday b/c of the nice weather we were having, but wasnt feeling well enough :-\  I havent been away from her exept for work...and this is the one wknd that everyone (and i mean everyone!) i know had other plans...my friends and bf are away and my brother and sister had their own plans...i planned to take my youngest sis out, but w/ this headache i have, we only made it out for a 20 min walk :-( i know she needs to get out as well...i will try tomorrow to take her out, after popping some sudafed tonite!  I hope u have a nice holiday wknd! Talk to u soon!
Posts.Title: For my Mom aka Superwoman Nicole_Bronx Nicole_Bronx

Posts.Content: Aug 19, 2009 04:13PM Nicole_Bronx wrote: Hey all!!! I am back, have been very busy and tired lately...I hope to reconnect w/ many (or all) of you! Will post up new info and progress soon :-)
Posts.Title: For my Mom aka Superwoman Nicole_Bronx Nicole_Bronx

Posts.Content: May 6, 2009 10:52PM Nicole_Bronx wrote: Hi Beth! Yes I am from the Castle Hill area of the Bronx... I am definitely going to be there w/ my mom every step of the way, remaining strong and informed for her...It's soooo great to hear that you are cancer free!!! I am on the verge of tears here just reading those words, that's wonderful! I am definitely grateful to have found this site.  Well we just met w/ a 2nd surgeon for that second opinion and have decided to go with her rather than the first surgeon we met because we just feel more comfortable/confident that she will provide the best treatment.  Preparing for the next couple of tests (bloodwork) and the date of the surgery...which will most likely be a lumpectomy...and still trying to live life normally and of course preparing for mother's day this wknd Again, Congratulations on being cancer FREE!!!!! (again w/ the tears and lump in my throat lol, Happy tears )
Posts.Title: For my Mom aka Superwoman Nicole_Bronx Nicole_Bronx

Posts.Content: May 10, 2009 10:21AM Nicole_Bronx wrote: Hi Beth, That's interesting I will look into that book. My mother's surgeon is Dr. Alison Estabrook, she works for St.Luke's Hosp. She was actually the doctor we went to for a second opinion. May I take a moment to vent? I am getting very frustrated and upset w/ certain family members calling my mother 3 times daily and NOT b/c they want to see how SHE'S doing, but for HER to comfort THEM!!!!!!! I do tell her that she should tell them that its giving her more grief than if they would never call at all! But I hold back a lot and i sure don't vent on her b/c I don't want to cause added stress, but I am to the pt that I WILL call them and give a piece of my mind! Okay, I got it out, my 20yr old sis and I discuss this almost daily b/c its a build up of things that has happened in the past w/ the fam...its just ridiculous how SELFISH ppl are! Thanks for listening :-) and.. HAPPY MOTHER'S DAY to ALL the mommies out there!!!!! :-)
Posts.Title: For my Mom aka Superwoman Nicole_Bronx Nicole_Bronx
For my Mom aka Superwoman Nicole_Bronx Nicole_Bronx

Posts.Content: May 19, 2009 02:52PM Nicole_Bronx wrote: OMG everyone!!! I am on my way home WITH my mom (post surgery) and couldn't wait to post this! Initial Report came back w/ GREAT news! Her sentinal node biopsy came back NEGATIVE!!! Needless to say we r all ECSTATIC!!! Of course I am very happy, but waiting for that Final path report which will come in 10 days...I am just so happy to hear she will be OKAY! I got thru this so far w/ the help of this community of WONDERFUL women!!! (I can't say that enough) and my family (the ones that have not caused drama) and can't thank u all enough for ur support, words of wisdom, ur personal stories, advice and esp the well wishes and prayers for my mother...I will be back soon with more updates :-) Luv (a very happy) Nicole!!! Kisses and big hugs!!!
Posts.Title: For my Mom aka Superwoman Nicole_Bronx Nicole_Bronx

Posts.Content: May 26, 2009 01:07PM Nicole_Bronx wrote: omg! sorry to hear about ur nephew :-( i hope he's doing okay...i'm not too worried about the Swine Flu in my case, I think it's actually a severe sinus headache ( i am just getting used to the idea of having allergies, developed them about 3 or 4 yrs ago ).  i am supposed to be taking my allergy medicine everyday, but i hate the idea of that...sooooo i neglected myself a bit, but will use better judgement when these peak times for allergy sufferers occur.  I also have an appt to see my doctor in the next coming week... but don't get me wrong, i am also doing what i can to protect myself from the Swine Flu, hand washing included! My Best to you and ur nephew!
